| http://www.emcouncils.gov.uk/Home
}} The 'East Midlands' is one of nine official regions of England at the first
level of NUTS for statistical purposes. It consists of the eastern part of the
traditional region of the Midlands and encompasses the combined area of
Nottinghamshire, Derbyshire, Leicestershire, Rutland, Northamptonshire and most
of Lincolnshire. A looser definition of the East Midlands might also include the
City of Peterborough (traditionally associated with Northamptonshire, but now
included in Cambridgeshire), and North Lincolnshire. http://www.nspcc.org.uk/what-we-do/NSPCC-in-your-area/east-
midlands/services-in-your-area/services-in-your-area_wda84622.html
categories: NUTS 1 statistical regions of the European Union
